item.description:
VERY IMPORTANT:
In the interest of safety all participants should be able to hike at a MODERATE PLUS PACE, equal to book time or less. This is a long, strenuous route with no room to add time for participants unable to hike at the designated pace. If your hiking ability is not at this level you should consider a different hike that is shorter and less strenuous.

AMC classifies this hike as a strenuous. Certain sections of the trail are steep and challenging.

starting at North Twin Trailhead ( end at Gale River Loop)

hike 4.30 mi/3 hr 39 min/+2917 ft on the North Twin Trail
The trail leaves the parking area and crosses the river three times, ascending easily on an old railroad grade with occasional bypasses. After the third crossing, the trail begins to climb away from the river and railroad grade, crossing and recrossing a tributary brook. The long, steady climb continues, and the trail becomes quite steep, reaching the ledgy end of the ridge. The trail now climbs easily, passes a superb outlook ledge, and reaches the summit of North Twin. The North Twin Spur continues straight ahead to South Twin, and a side path leads right 60 yd. to a fine outlook from the western edge of the summit area.
to North Twin Mtn
Totals
Distance 4.30 mi
Time 3 hr 39 min
Elev Gain +3007 ft
Elev Loss -90 ft
Elev Change +2917 ft

Back to here
hike 1.30 mi/49 min/+129 ft on the North Twin Spur
to South Twin Mtn
Totals
Distance 5.60 mi
Time 4 hr 28 min
Elev Gain +3453 ft
Elev Loss -407 ft
Elev Change +3046 ft

Back to here
hike 0.80 mi/59 min/-1128 ft on the Twinway
The North Twin Spur begins here, turning right and running 40 yd. to the north knob and then on to North Twin, while the Twinway turns left (west) and begins a steady steep descent toward Galehead Hut. At the bottom of this descent, it crosses a small sag, passes over a ledgy hump, and soon reaches a junction 40 yd. from the hut, where the Garfield Ridge Trail enters on the right and the Frost Trail continues straight ahead to the hut.
to the junction of Frost Trail and Garfield Ridge Trail
hike 0.03 mi/1 min/+5 ft on the Frost Trail
to AMC Galehead Hut
hike 0.11 mi/3 min/-29 ft on the Frost Trail
to the junction of Twin Brook Trail
hike 0.36 mi/20 min/+268 ft on the Frost Trail
After a short distance, the Frost Trail ascends a steep pitch, at the top of which a side path leads left 30 yd. to an excellent outlook over the Twin Brook valley. The main trail continues at a moderate grade to the rather flat and nearly viewless summit.
to Galehead Mtn
Totals
Distance 6.90 mi
Time 5 hr 51 min
Elev Gain +3780 ft
Elev Loss -1619 ft
Elev Change +2162 ft

Back to here
hike 0.36 mi/20 min/-268 ft on the Frost Trail
The Frost Trail descends steeply from the viewless summit of Galehead. It reaches an excellent outlook over Twin Brook Valley.
to the junction of Twin Brook Trail
hike 0.11 mi/3 min/+29 ft on the Frost Trail
to AMC Galehead Hut
hike 0.03 mi/1 min/-5 ft on the Frost Trail
to the junction of Garfield Ridge Trail and Twinway
hike 0.60 mi/30 min/-356 ft on the Garfield Ridge Trail
to the junction of Gale River Trail
A bridge 1.7 miles from the trailhead was lost. WMNF crews have constructed a rock crossing that should serve well in low or moderate stream flows.
hike 4.00 mi/2 hr 56 min/-1806 ft on the Gale River Trail
From the Garfield Ridge Trail, the Gale River Trail descends steeply down the north side of the ridge on rough terrain. The trail emerges at a gravel bank at the base of a slide where there are fine views up the valley and toward the Twins. The trail then passes the gravel outwash of an overgrown slide and descends the bank of the North Branch, which it crosses on large stepping stones (difficult only in very high water). It then joins an old logging road. It crosses a major tributary and passes through an old logging-camp site. It then becomes somewhat rougher, with several bypasses of muddy sections and washouts. It comes to the edge of the stream, crosses it on large rocks near the site of a bridge that was washed away in 2005. The logging road descends easily along the west side of the North Branch of the Gale River, some distance away from the stream. It turns left, leaving the old road, and crosses a tributary brook. It ascends the bank then leaves the woods arriving at its terminus at the Gale River Loop Rd.
to Gale River Trailhead

Totals

Distance 12.00 mi
Time 9 hr 41 min
Elev Gain +3932 ft
Elev Loss -4175 ft
Elev Change -244 ft





Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.
item.name: Galehead and The Twins, strenuous hike
